conclusion: Analyze how shadows will change based on light source movement.
Four objects (typewriter, alarm clock, egg, remote control) cast shadows A, B, C, D downwards and slightly to the right.
Light source is positioned above and to the left relative to objects and camera.
Principles of shadow casting: direction, position, size (length and shape).
Direction of shadow is opposite to light source direction.
Shadow position is away from object opposite to light source.
Shadow length depends on light angle; lower light creates longer shadows.
Shadow shape is projection of object's outline from light source perspective.
Light source moves to back left or right, potentially further away and lower.
Light source moving back implies moving behind objects from current viewpoint.
Back-left movement: shadows cast in front and to the right of objects.
Back-left movement: shadows become longer and change shape.
Back-right movement: shadows cast in front and to the left of objects.
Back-right movement: shadows become longer and change shape.
All shadows behave similarly in direction and size change.
Back-left scenario: shadows move to front-right and become longer.
Back-right scenario: shadows move to front-left and become longer.
Final answer: Shadows change position and size based on light source movement.
